content: stitches note the basket weave pattern does have some stretch so in most cases the afcn = either 66 stitches factor of 6 or 64 stitches factor of 8 simpler option will suffice either dk approximate method foundation round will be 66 stitches each square/ block will be three stitches wide 1 determine the person s head circumference chain number hccn either six stitches in a repeat there will be 22 blocks around and 11 repeats in a round a determine the relaxed number of chains that fit around the person s head or or b ask the person to measure their head circumference using a tape measure then determine the relaxed number of chains that are equivalent to this tape foundation round will be 64 stitches each square/ block will be four stitches wide measure circumference eight stitches in a repeat there will be 16 blocks around and 8 repeats in a round 2 get the adjusted foundation chain number afcn by determining the factor of eight that is the closest to the hccn for most adults this will be as per the standard pattern count of 80 chain younger children will be adjusted to 72 chain or 64 chain and babies to 56 chain page | 7 pattern support/ follow me acknowledgements instructions a little background regarding this design i have made this beanie design for over 20 years during this time i have made a number of these beanies as presents and many more for charity they are a great charity beanie as the design is suitable for wear by both sexes and the basket weave results in a warm fabric pair the beanie with a simple basket weave scarf or basket weave cowl for a very cosy charitable gift whilst making charitable items for our #cityofunley #unleylibraries #unleycrochetcrew for #winterwarmers2019 i decided it was time that i wrote up a pattern for the design so that others can make charity beanies with it too i have named the beanie the unley chill beanie as i have spent many wonderful years living in different parts of the unley city council area south australia it s a great place to live and bring up a family our #unleycrochetcrew made our first group
